etymology.description: Originally 與(與) (yǔ, "and") -> 與 simplified by removing the top horizontal stroke -> 与(与) (yǔ, "and")
etymology.interpretation: The character 与(与) is a simplified variant of 與(與) (yǔ, "and"), created by removing the top stroke of the traditional form for simplicity.
etymology.simplification: 与(与) simplified by removing the top stroke, providing a more straightforward written form while retaining the original meaning.

examples.chinese: 我与老师讨论问题(我與老師討論問題)。
examples.english: I discuss problems with the teacher.

examples.chinese: 他与她一同学习(他與她一同學習)，互相帮助(互相幫助)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǔ tā yītóng xuéxí, hùxiāng bāngzhù.
examples.english: He and she study together, helping each other.

examples.chinese: 书与笔不可分(書與筆不可分)。
